alert.note: Alert for Capitan And Sacramento Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 05 at 4:41AM MST until March 05 at 6:00PM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THROUGH 6 PM MST TODAY FOR THE SACRAMENTO MOUNTAINS ON SOUTH CENTRAL NEW MEXICO DUE TO DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS... .Southwest flow aloft will help generate windy conditions across much of southern New Mexico this afternoon. The strongest winds will be in the Sacramento Mountains. If you combine these winds with min RH values of 10 to 20% we will Red Flag criteria for several hours this afternoon which will lead to elevated fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND DRY CONDITIONS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 113... The National Weather Service in El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 6 PM MST this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...The Sacramento Mountains of south central New Mexico * WIND...Southwest winds of 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 45 mph. * HUMIDITY...10 to 20 percent. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that elevated to critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
